title: Fall of a unicorn: Can ShopClues find a white knight to claw back lost turf from Flipkart and Amazon?
text:
Three years since its headline-grabbing fundraise, ShopClues’ journey has changed course for the worse. The online shopping platform, run by Gurugram-based Clues Network, has of late been surviving on bridge rounds, with its existing backers throwing in a lifeline. But with a large base of upwardly-mobile customers and a huge data trove on their buying habits, ShopClues has reasons to be optimistic, as India’s tier II market remains underpenetrated.

ShopClues holds a meeting of its sellers; courtesy of ShopClues via Facebook

But for that, ShopClues’ prospective white knight will have to take on its liabilities, pay off the USD7.7 million venture debt, and give its founders a small exit. If that doesn’t happen, ShopClues would resemble the Greek mythological character Sisyphus who rolls a giant boulder uphill, only to watch it come rolling down.
